A wise old owl saw them quarrel and came to help. The owl said, "Why don't you both draw together?" Tim and Ron liked the idea. They stopped quarreling and started to draw. Tim drew slow circles, while Ron drew fast lines. They made a beautiful picture with the pastel chalk and became happy friends again.

A little boy named Tim saw a big red balloon. He wanted to hold it. Tim asked the balloon man, "Can I have the big red balloon, please?" The balloon man said, "Yes, you can, but be careful not to release it!"
Tim held the balloon tight, but then something unexpected happened. A tiny bird flew by and pecked the balloon. "Pop!" The balloon burst, and the bird flew away. Tim was sad, but then he saw a big rainbow in the sky. The rainbow made him smile, and he forgot about the balloon.

A little bird was sitting on the branch. The bird looked at the cap and said, "Hey, that's my cap!" Spot said, "I'm sorry, I didn't know it was yours. I just wanted to play."
The bird and Spot became friends. They took turns kicking the cap and having fun. At the end of the day, they were both tired but happy. Spot learned that it's always good to share and make new friends.

Avery's mom said, "Avery, look. Do you know what that is?"

Once upon a time, there was a wild bird named Tom. He loved to fly and sing all day. Tom had many friends in the big tree.
One day, Tom saw a little car that needed help. The car was sad because it could not go.

A little girl named Lisa had an idea. She took her ice cream and walked up to the frog. She gave the frog her ice cream. The frog ate the ice cream, and it was very happy. The frog then jumped off the road, and the traffic started moving again. Tom was so proud of Lisa, and he gave her a new ice cream. From that day on, the town loved Tom's ice cream even more, and they all became good friends with the big, green frog.
